result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melodie Cheree Taylor

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Melodie Cheree Taylor appeared by video, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Melodie Cheree Taylor.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Joshua Stowe sworn and testified. Exhibit #1: Report- offered. Attorney Mickelson objects to exhibit. Court gives copy of report to Attorney Mickelson. Cross. Follow up. Attorney Pozorski asks court to take judicial notice of  Grant County cases 22CM13 and 21CF292. Court receives exhibit and takes judicial notice. Attorney Pozorski heard and requests bind over. Attorney Mickelson heard and objects to bind over. Court heard and binds matter over. Defendant waives formal reading and pleads not guilty to charge. Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on November 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 4, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Melodie Cheree Taylor not in court.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Melodie Cheree Taylor.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. State requests a warrant on defendant's nonappearance. Attorney Mickelson objects to warrant. Court authorizes warrant. Court withdrawals warrant. Defendant appears late, from Grant County Jail. Defendant is currently on a probation hold. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Attorney Mickelson has been appointed. State requests a $500 cash bond. Attorney Mickelson requests a signature bond. Court heard and orders $500 cash bond. Preliminary hearing set.
